newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Former Apple CEO Sculley eyes Israeli high-tech.
newsitem.headline: Former Apple CEO Sculley eyes Israeli high-tech.

text.p: Former Apple CEO John Sculley said on Sunday he was joining the board of Catalyst, parent company of HK Strategy & Finance Ltd, an Israel-based investment firm specialising in the Israeli high-tech industry.
Sculley, chief executive officer of California-based Internet software developer Live Picture and a self-styled venture "catalyst", has had a business relationship with HK for several years.

"We are actively involved in several projects. We are not making any announcements today as to what those are. But I think you will see in the relatively near term a number of examples of activities that HK and I are involved with," Sculley said.

"I think you will see a variety of things which will include investments," he told a news conference at which he said he was joining the Catalyst board of European merchant bankers and industrialists.

HK president Robin Hacke said the investment firm, which describes its business as building networks among U.S. European and Israeli partners, was "actively looking for additional companies, in the fields of software and communications in particular, where we can be active and involved".
"Part of what John will be doing during the time that he's here is looking at some additional opportunities and he expects to be here again," she said at the news conference.
Sculley is in Israel for a week to attend an Internet conference.
"I'll probably be here...about four visits a year," he said.
